review_title: Definitely not Moving any Mountains here......

pros: Very helpful team! All of them are motivated to work towards improvement.
cons: Lack of co-ordination between different departments

pros: Lots of autonomy. Own office. Generous PTO policy. Dynamic work days.
cons: Entry level.  Blurred lines between PR and Marketing gets confusing and annoying. Doesn't pay well. There are clear favorites with senior management. Beholden to donors.

pros: Great Culture and excellent hours....Outside of the pay I would highly recommend United Way.

review_title: A good introduction to individual income tax career
job_title: VITA Volunteer in Costa Mesa, CA

Positive working environment
Good training
Good foods depend on locations 
Give back to the community
cons: None, I enjoyed being a volunteer at VITA

pros: good for entry level employees - and for learning
cons: super political, horrible incompetent senior management, lack of trust, does not hold abusive employees accountable.

pros: Flexibility to work independently. Everyone is vey nice and helpful. Work environment is healthy and encouraging. Work hours are reasonable.
cons: Managers and leaders are old-school, not willing to take risk, which is reasonable for this type of company.

review_title: Great team to be part of.
pros: A global brand that attracts and keeps people interested in advancing the common good.
cons: Modest pay, culture at times old fashion.

pros: Great non profit with spotless track record. Wonderful and well deserved reputation. Always putting community needs first.
cons: Not always opportunities for advancement. At times work hours and overtime expected, especially during times of disaster.

pros: Great team to work work, everyone is highly motivated, and is happy to come to work each day.
cons: Being a non-profit, salaries are not as much as they might be at other businesses.

pros: Get to help others in your community, feel good about your work, feel connected to community, often make great friends in both co-workers and donors
cons: Low pay for the amount of work, not always great benefits

pros:
- Organization that does great work for its community
- Onboard's passionate people
- Great training
cons:
- Slow decision making
- Inefficient use of employee time

pros: Great mission - most people are nice and fun to work with.
cons: poor leadership, especially in finance. High turnover due to over the top management with ridiculous expectations.

pros: It was a  positive family-like environment to work in.  Awesome paid time off and they are very understanding and flexible. I would recommend to anyone!
cons: Wish there was more opportunities to grow within the company

pros: Wonderful people, deep relationships and a trusted social service and philanthropic partner in YYC.
cons: Some internal flux as the organization adapts to a changing economic and philanthropic environment.

pros:
Decent benefits, although those have declined.
Good work environment.
cons:
Silos. 
Not for profits did not recover the same way the private sector has since the great recession.
Bit of a my way or the highway complex in recent years.

pros: A shared mission to help others. Great compensation benefits. Telecommuting benefit, 401k, medical benefits. Staff events.
cons: Difficult to advance, some preference to racially white leadership. Low pay for regular workers and very little pay raise.

pros: We are able to be flexible with work and life. I was able to see real change and growth in the company and myself professionally.
cons: Had to wear many hats during the busy season

pros: Rewarding work, Fair Compensation, Supporting Coworkers
cons: Not many options to advance. Lot of management discord when I was there.

review_title: opportunity to work hard to make a difference in the lives of others and self
pros: meet incredibly caring people, opportunity to make a difference.
cons: lack of understanding/knowledge of the masses and resources to get them educated and engaged.

review_title: A view of the non-profit world
pros: Nice hours, decent work/life balance.
cons: When you see where your donations go it is very disheartening. So much money is used to pay for rich board members (taking them to nice restaurants, conferences, etc.). I also saw a huge disrespect for the poor, the people they supposedly want to help. The whole experience made me not want to donate to any non-profits ever again.

review_title: Data Entry part-time for the Finance Clerk
job_title: Data Entry for Finance Clerk in Anderson, SC

cons: Had trained to be a Data Entry Operator, but had never really performed on the job before.  I really enjoy the challenge.

pros: Well known, branded, potential to do lots of good in the community.  Met many influential peers and it looks great on the resume

pros: Lax work environment, flexibility in schedule, liberal with time off

pros: Community oriented, non-profit, community engagement, networking, and flexibility.

review_title: United way serves the community well by meeting the needs.
